#Text=Tehran
#Text=Tehran ( also spelled Teheran ) ( Persian : تهران ) , is the capital city of Iran .
#Text=A bustling metropolis of 14 million people , it sits at the foot of the towering Alborz mountain range .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Tehran is a cosmopolitan city , with great museums , parks , restaurants , and warm friendly people .
#Text=It deserves at least a few days of your Iranian itinerary .
#Text=The city can be roughly divided into two parts - north and south .
#Text=The northern districts of Tehran are more prosperous , modern , cosmopolitan and expensive while southern parts are less attractive but cheaper .
#Text=At the time of the Zand dynasty , it was a little town that was significant from a strategic point of view .

#Text=The first of the Qajar kings , Agha Mohammed Khan , named Tehran as the country 's capital in 1778 , and most of its growth started during the reign of a subsequent Qajar monarch , Fath-Ali Shah .
#Text=The castle which Agha Mohammed Khan had built was to contain the new majestic buildings .
#Text=At the same time , the city 's population doubled .

#Text=Due to the increasing significance of the city , gates , squares and mosques were built and it was at the time of Nassereddin Shah that the city 's master sketch was prepared and modern streets were constructed .
#Text=Later , huge central squares like Toopkhaneh square ( now Imam Khomeini ) and quite a few military buildings were built .
#Text=Even though the Qajar dynasty was in a period of decline , Tehran soon took the shape of a modern city .

#Text=The structure of large government buildings , new streets , recreation centres , urban service organizations , and academic and methodical centres were started , even as most of the old gates and buildings were destroyed and the city 's old architectural fabric replaced by a contemporary one .
#Text=Tehran has also earned itself an unenviable reputation as a smog-filled , traffic-clogged and featureless sprawl of concrete bursting at the seams with 14 million residents .
#Text=But you can also find an endless number of nice and cosy places in and around the city - if you know where to look .
#Text=Tehran is a city of more than 800 parks , all well-kept .
#Text=The city is nearly a mile high above sea level and as a result is cooler than other cities in the Middle East .
#Text=Summer temperatures are around 32°C or 90-95°F .
#Text=The air tends to be very dry .

#Text=A combination of factors make Tehran a pleasant place to visit : the dry climate which is cool in the evenings , the proximity of the mountains , the parks and gardens where flowers blossom all through the year , the alleys of trees in the avenues or even smaller streets , and even the water that runs down from the upper city along deep and wide gutters which look like small rivers during spring .
#Text=The Alborz range on the north of Tehran , which hosts the highest peak in Iran , provides fantastic conditions for ski lovers in the winter .
#Text=In winter , the mountain hotels and ski clubs at Shemshak , and Dizine are full several days a week .
#Text=Some specialist skiers consider the snow value in northern Tehran to be one of the most excellent in the world .
#Text=Get in
#Text=For information on Iranian visas please refer the Iran#visas page .
#Text=By plane

#Text=Imam Khomeini International Airport ( IKA ) ( 55 km southwest of the city center , Robat Karim railway station ( ایستگاه راه آهن رباط کریم ) around 3 km northwest near Line 1 ' Kahrizak ' ~ 20 km NE ) .
#Text=The only airport in Tehran to which international passenger flights operate .
#Text=Ground transportation :
#Text=Metro easiest way to reach city center is by metro line .
#Text=Line number 8 connects Airport Terminal A with metro line 1 ( red line ) ( 75000 rials , that can be used for the full network , Mar 2019 ) .
#Text=Buses between the airport and the city ( e. g.
#Text=Haram Metro station ) run every 30-60 min 07:00 - 23:00 .
#Text=They leave right in front of the main exit and cost 20,000-30,000 rial .
#Text=There are unconfirmed reports of a shuttle bus operating between IKIA and Mehrabad Airport every 4 – 5 hours .
#Text=Taxis cost a fixed rate of 800,000 rials ( or US$ 25 or € 20 as of Oct 2017 ) , ask at the taxi counter .
#Text=The drive to/from the city center takes 45 minutes without traffic , but can take upwards of 90 minutes with traffic .
#Text=There is a booth organizing taxis right outside the arrivals hall .
#Text=You can also bargain with taxis dropping off passengers at the arrivals hall because otherwise they would have to go back to Tehran empty .
#Text=Taxis to the nearest metro station ( Haram-e-Motahhar ) cost 500,000 rials .
#Text=Shuttle taxis and green minibuses operate between the airport and Shahed Station on the red line of the metro .
#Text=This can be a convenient option going to the airport from town , but finding the shuttle taxis at the airport will be difficult as many do n't stop there .

#Text=At 7000 rials for a metro ticket and 40,000 rials for a shuttle taxi ( they will try to rip you off or charge for bringing in luggage even if there is space , so make sure to only occupy one seat if you do n't want to pay extra ) , it is probably the cheapest option from town that does n't require waiting a long time for the bus ( shuttle taxis leave when full ) .
#Text=At Shahed station , get out to the parking area ( there is only one exit and you ca n't miss it ) and on the very left you will see green minibuses .
#Text=It takes about 30-40 min from there to the airport .
#Text=Last one departs around 21:30 .
#Text=Metro Line 1 ( Red ) During daytime there is a metro from IKA to Tehran .
#Text=The trains run hourly so check schedule ( Sep 2017 ) .
#Text=Tehran 's Mehrabad airport ( THR ) .
#Text=Mehrabad is only used for domestic and cargo flights .
#Text=It is connected to Tehran Metro Line 4 .
#Text=Despite the warnings in some travel guides , there is no exit fee for foreign travellers , neither in Mehrabad nor in Imam Khomeini Airport .
#Text=The exit fee applies to foreign travellers only when leaving Iran on land or by sea .
